quotes.quote: Everything is theoretically impossible until it is done.
quotes.author: Robert A. Heinlein

quotes.quote: The science of operations, as derived from mathematics more especially, is a science of itself, and has its own abstract truth and value.
quotes.author: Ada Lovelace

quotes.quote: Scientists have become the bearers of the torch of discovery in our quest for knowledge.
quotes.author: Stephen Hawking

quotes.quote: Science cannot solve the ultimate mystery of nature. And that is because, in the last analysis, we ourselves are a part of the mystery that we are trying to solve.
quotes.author: Max Planck

quotes.quote: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.
quotes.author: Marie Curie

quotes.quote: Exploration is what you do when you don't know what you're doing. That's what scientists do every day. If a scientist already knew what they were doing, they wouldn't be discovering anything, because they already knew what they were doing.
quotes.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quotes.quote: It is strange that only extraordinary men make the discoveries, which later appear so easy and simple.
quotes.author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

quotes.quote: Equipped with his five senses, man explores the universe around him and calls the adventure Science.
quotes.author: Edwin Powell Hubble

quotes.quote: Computer science is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes.
quotes.author: Edsger Dijkstra

quotes.quote: The whole secret of life is to be interested in one thing profoundly and in a thousand things well.
quotes.author: Horace Walpole
